column4: hello... need big help here!!! I was doing an system update, and it wanted to *change menu.lst* - at the time I told it to *keep current file unchanged*... but my kernel did not get updated... now I need to know the command to go back to that screen, so that it can generate the kernel entry in grub with proper UUID... help!
enhazlett: it does not work.... no new kernel entry is added to menu.lst, and no uuid number
enhazlett: the graph screen that comes up when that happens, which command is that?
you know when you update the kernel... through system updates, there comes a screen UI asking what to do with MENU.LST... i need to run *THAT*...which command is it
that is the dpkg configuration screen
yes!! dpkg configuration screen.. which one is it for update menu lst?
I don't get the graph screen
Not updating initrd symbolic links since we are being updated/reinstalled
(2.6.28-13.45 was configured last, according to dpkg)
the only other thing i can recommend it to reinstall the package with apt-get install --reinstall to get the configuration...
it won't bring that screen back
